metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8173 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pmd_none_or_trans_huge_or_clear_bad function in include/asm-generic/pgtable.h in the Linux kernel before 3.13 on NUMA systems does not properly determine whether a Page Middle Directory (PMD) entry is a transparent huge-table entry, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted MADV_WILLNEED madvise system call that leverages the absence of a page-table lock.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-1.16').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
